prompt.description: Describe your favorite meal, and write a persuasive argument to convince someone to try that meal. Support your position with facts and examples from your experience.

criterion.name: Content
criterion.label: Content
criterion.prompt: Did the response describe a meal and did it describe why someone should chose to eat it?

option.name: Off Topic
option.label: Off Topic
option.explanation: The essay is off-topic or does not answer all or part of the question.

option.name: No Explanation
option.label: No Explanation
option.explanation: A meal is described, but no argument is made to persuade the reader to try it.

option.name: Unclear recommendation
option.label: Unclear recommendation
option.explanation: A meal is not described, but an argument is made to persuade the reader to try it.

option.name: Persuasive recommendation
option.label: Persuasive recommendation
option.explanation: The essay give a good description of the meal and provides supporting reasons for trying the meal.

criterion.name: Organization & Clarity
criterion.label: Organization & Clarity
criterion.prompt: How well did the response use language?

option.name: Confusing
option.label: Confusing
option.explanation: It is difficult to identify the argument and main idea.

option.name: Basic Structure
option.label: Basic Structure
option.explanation: The essay provides a main idea. Additional details are provided, and some support the main idea.

option.name: Clear Structure
option.label: Clear Structure
option.explanation: The essay provides a clear main idea supported by specific details.

option.name: Complete Structure
option.label: Complete Structure
option.explanation: The essay has a complete structure: an introduction, statement of main idea, supporting details and summary.

criterion.name: Persuasiveness
criterion.label: Persuasiveness
criterion.prompt: How well did the response convince you to try the meal that it describes?

option.name: Unconvincing
option.label: Unconvincing
option.explanation: The author did not present a persuasive argument, and I have no interest in trying this meal.

option.name: Interesting
option.label: Interesting
option.explanation: The author’s argument was somewhat persuarsive. I need more information to consider trying this meal.

option.name: Persuasive
option.label: Persuasive
option.explanation: The author’s argument was persuasive, and I will consider trying the meal.

option.name: Inspiring
option.label: Inspiring
option.explanation: The author presented an exceptionally strong case and has convinced me to try the meal.

rubric.feedbackprompt: How does this meal compare with the meal you submitted?
